issue.title: Expose TypeMap and PropertyMap in IMemberConfigurationExpression
issue.body:
Similar to issue #531, it would be useful to be able to extend property maps using extension methods on an IMemberConfigurationExpression. However this interface does not expose the underlying TypeMap and PropertyMap, nor even the TDestination type, so it is difficult to create such extensions.

Further it would be useful to have a general bag of properties that can be stored on a PropertyMap for custom extensions so that extra data doesn't have to be stored separately.

body: This property is gone again in 5.0

Can you recommend an alternative then, if TypeMap is gone forever? Have been relying on the IgnoreAllNonExisting extension method for a while, and am not familiar enough with AutoMapper to know where to start to fix it.
@leadensky don't use IgnoreNonAllExisting, that was a hack. Instead, use `CreateMap<FooDto, Foo>(MemberList.Source);` or use `CreateMap<Foo, FooDto>().ReverseMap();`

Thanks for the quick response @jbogard. For reference, I wound up doing the following:

`CreateMap<Calculation, CalculationChecklist>(MemberList.Source)
.ForMember(x => x.ProjectName, opts => opts.MapFrom(src => src.Project.ShortDescription))
                .ForMember(x => x.ProjectNumber, opts => opts.MapFrom(src => src.Project.ProjectNumber))
                .ForMember(x => x.ClientName, opts => opts.MapFrom(src => src.Project.Client.Name))
                .ForSourceMember(x => x.Specification, opts => opts.Ignore())
                .ForSourceMember(x => x.Specification_ID, opts => opts.Ignore());`

explicitly ignoring each of the source members I didn't want to map. Would love to know if there's an easier way.
An easier way to do what? You WANT to explicitly ignore. You can also decorate those members with the IgnoreAttribute.

OK, it just felt painful having to add in all the explicit Ignore statements after having used the IgnoreAllNonExisting hack. Thanks for the IgnoreAttribute suggestion. I'll consider that for future use.

Or maybe I need to look at ReverseMap().

The reason you want to be explicit is that leaving it implicit with IgnoreAllNonExisting means you'll miss when something is renamed.

Another thought though, if you do ReverseMap, I would think you could even skip configuration validation for those maps.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
